block.p: Around Town
Museums and Sites

AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Central Park West and 79th Street. Tuesday, 6 to 9 p.m., ''Up the Hudson River,'' a three-hour cruise on the river to learn about its history and geology; $45; $42.50 for members, students and 60+. (Information: 212-769-5200.)Through Jan. 6, ''Mythic Creatures: Dragons, Unicorns and Mermaids.'' Through April 6, 2008, ''Beyond,'' an exhibition of more than 30 large-format photographs of Earth's planetary neighbors, in the museum's Imax Gallery. Through Jan. 6, ''The Unknown Audubons: Mammals of North America,'' a display of more than 40 artworks depicting animals. In the Imax theater, ''Dinosaurs Alive!,'' a film about museum paleontologists in search of dinosaur remains. Timed tickets to ''Mythic Creatures'' and ''Gold'' include museum admission. (212) 769-5100 or (212) 769-5200; $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for 12 and younger. Imax movie tickets, which include museum admission, are $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for children 12 and under. Suggested museum admission: $14; $10.50 for students and 60+; children, $8. Combination tickets, including museum and Rose Center admission and the Hayden Planetarium space show (''Cosmic Collisions''): $22; $16.50 for students and 60+; $13 for 12 and younger; under 2, free. Admission that includes all activities: $30; $23 for students and 60+; $19 for 12 and younger. Museum hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (to 8:45 p.m. on Fridays). amnh.org.

MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, Fifth Avenue at 103rd Street. Today at 6:30 p.m., ''The Good Fight: The Abraham Lincoln Brigade in the Spanish Civil War,'' a screening of a documentary narrated by Studs Terkel, followed by a discussion with the filmmakers. Tomorrow at 1 p.m., ''Dog Owners and Their Dogs,'' a reading from ''The New Yorkers: A Novel,'' a book about Upper West Siders and their dogs by Cathleen Schine. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. (212) 534-1672. Suggested admission: $9; $5 for students and 62+; free for children under 12; $20 for families; free on Sundays, 10 a.m. to noon. mcny.org.
Gardens

BROOKLYN BOTANIC GARDEN, 1000 Washington Avenue, Prospect Heights. Through June 30, ''June Is Rose Month,'' with thousands of blooming varieties. Tuesdays through Fridays, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, Sundays and holidays (except Labor Day), 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. (718) 623-7200. $8; $4 for students and 65+; free for under 12 and members at all times and for 65+ on Fridays. Free admission all day on Tuesdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. bbg.org.

NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN, Bronx River Parkway (Exit 7W) and Fordham Road, the Bronx. Rose Month, with activities tomorrow and Sunday. Through Sept. 16, ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' a conservatory display. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tram tours daily, every 20 minutes. (718) 817-8700. Combination ticket, which includes admission for all displays, garden sites, tours, tram tours and events: $18; students and 62+, $16; children 2 to 13, $5; free for children under 2. General garden grounds admission: $6; $3 for 62+; $2 for students; $1 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Conservatory admission: $5; $4 for students and 62+; $3 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Grounds admission free on Wednesdays and 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. Parking, $10; nybg.org.
Events

AFFORDABLE ART FAIR, Metropolitan Pavilion, 125 West 18th Street, Chelsea. Today and tomorrow, noon to 8 p.m.; Sunday, noon to 5 p.m. An exhibition with related events. (212) 255-2003. $15 per day, $10 for students, free for youths under 12.

BATTERY PARK CITY PARKS CONSERVANCY, Lower Manhattan. Tonight at 7, music by Terre Roche and Marian Wilson. Events tomorrow: at 8:30 a.m., the Manhattan Island Marathon, a 28.5-mile swim around Manhattan, beginning and ending at Battery Park City's South Cove (registration is closed); at 12:30, swing music by the Missing Cats. Race-viewing and other information: (212) 267-9700; bpcparks.org. Free.

BRYANT PARK SUMMER FILM FESTIVAL, Fifth Avenue and 42nd Street. Monday at dusk, ''Annie Hall'' (1977), directed by Woody Allen. The series will run Mondays through Aug. 20. Sponsored by HBO and the Bryant Park Corporation. bryantpark.org. Free.
CHRISTOPHER East STREET FESTIVAL, from Seventh to Greenwich Avenues. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
COOPER SQUARE COMMITTEE STREET FAIR, Third Avenue, between 6th and 14th Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
FRIENDS OF THE 13TH PRECINCT COMMUNITY COUNCIL STREET FAIR, Second Avenue, between 23rd and 34th Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
INTERNATIONAL IMMIGRANTS FOUNDATION STREET FAIR, Avenue of the Americas, between 42nd and 56th Streets. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
JUNETEENTH COMMITTEE STREET FAIR, West 116th Street, between Fifth and Lenox Avenues. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
KIDNEY AND UROLOGY FOUNDATION FESTIVAL, Lexington Avenue, between 34th and 42nd Streets. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
LEXINGTON AVENUE FESTIVAL, from 34th to 42nd Street. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

LUNCH AND LEARN; KREISCHERVILLE: A WALK INTO THE PAST, Clay Pit Ponds State Park Preserve, 83 Nielsen Avenue, Charleston, Staten Island. Wednesday at noon, a walking tour of the Staten Island area formerly known as Kreischerville, as well as a lecture and lunch. Sponsored by the Staten Island Museum. (718) 727-1135, Ext. 115. $24, $20 for members.

MUSEUM WITHOUT WALLS: YESTERDAY, TODAY AND TOMORROW, Bryant Park, Avenue of the Americas, at 40th Street. Tomorrow, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., an art exhibition with storytelling and children's activities; rain date, June 23. Sponsored by Art Without Walls. (631) 567-9418. Free.
music in the WEST SIDE COMMUNITY GARDEN, 89th and 90th Streets, between Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues. Sunday at 2 pm., a pop concert by the Anixter Rice Winds. westsidecommunitygarden.org. Free.
OUR LADY OF POMPEI FESTIVAL, Bleecker Street, between Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
SEVENTH HEAVEN STREET FESTIVAL, Seventh Avenue, from Flatbush Avenue to 16th Street, Park Slope, Brooklyn. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
WASHINGTON HEIGHTS ART SHOW, 181st Street, between Broadway and Fort Washington Avenue. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Spoken Word

CLASSIC AND NEW POETRY READING, International Center of Photography, 1133 Avenue of the Americas, at 43rd Street. Monday night at 7, in conjunction with the exhibition ''Let Your Motto Be Resistance: African American Portraits.'' Also sponsored by Cave Canem and the Poetry Society of America. (212) 857-0001. $5.
92nd Street Y, 1395 Lexington Avenue. Monday night at 8, a conversation between Yoko Ono and Anthony DeCurtis, a music editor and writer; $25. (212) 415-5500.
Walking Tours

ADVENTURE ON A SHOESTRING Tomorrow at 2:30 p.m., ''Charming Carnegie Hill,'' with stops at the Guggenheim Museum and the Carnegie Mansion, meeting on the southeast corner of Fifth Avenue and 86th Street. (212) 265-2663. $5.

BIG ONION WALKING TOURS Sunday at 1 p.m., ''Annual Father's Day Multi Ethnic Eating Tour,'' covering Lower Manhattan, meeting on the southeast corner of Essex and Delancey Streets; $20, $17 and $15. (212) 439-6200; bigonion.com.

BROOKLYN CENTER FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT Tomorrow at 11 a.m., ''At Home on the Upper West Side,'' passes apartment buildings, row houses and public institutions, meeting on Broadway and 73rd Street. (718) 788-8500, Ext. 208. $13; $10 formembers; $8 for 62+ and students.
ELY JACQUES KAHN'S ART DECO NEW YORK Sunday at 10 a.m., meeting on the southwest corner of Seventh Avenue and 45th Street. Sponsored by In Depth Walking Tours. (917) 607-9019. $20.

FATHER'S DAY DOUBLE-HEADER: THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE AND BROOKLYN DODGERS Tomorrow and Sunday at 2 p.m., a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, followed by a tour of Brooklyn Heights sites associated with famous ball players. Sponsored by NYC Discovery Tours. Reservations and meeting place: (212) 465-3331. $14.

DR. PHIL: NEW YORK WALKS AND TALKS Tomorrow at 10:30 a.m., ''The Sinking of the General Slocum: The Rise and Fall of Kleindeutschland or the German East Village,'' meeting in front of the Ottendorfer branch of the New York Public Library, 135 Second Avenue, between St. Marks Place and Ninth Street. (888) 377-4455. $15.

MADISON SQUARE ART: PAST AND PRESENT Tonight at 6 and tomorrow at 1 p.m., a tour devoted to the work of the Saint-Gaudens, Stanford White and Roxy Paine, meeting at the fountain plaza in Madison Square Park, Fifth Avenue and 23rd Street. (212) 538-9310. Free.

MUNICIPAL ART SOCIETY Tomorrow at 11 a.m., ''Parks and Places of Lower Manhattan,'' a walk from some of the oldest parks and plaza in Lower Manhattan to City Hall Park, meeting on the steps of the former United States Customs House, 1 Bowling Green. (212) 439-1049. $15, $12 for members.

NEW YORK LIKE A NATIVE Tomorrow at 1:30 p.m., ''Williamsburg: History, Art and Beer'' includes visits to art galleries and the Brooklyn Brewery, where free samples will be available. Meeting place: (718) 393-7537. $17.

NOCTURNAL SAFARI WALK OF THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT Tomorrow night at 8 p.m., passes Trinity Church, Federal Hall and the American Museum of the American Indian, meeting in front of McDonald's, 160 Broadway, between Maiden Lane and Liberty Street. Sponsored by Bernie's New York. (718) 655-1883. $10.
Recreation

WABC FATHER'S DAY FIGHT AGAINST PROSTATE CANCER, Central Park. Sunday at 8:30 a.m., a five-mile run beginning on the West Drive at 69th Street, followed at 10:15 a.m. by races for children 2 to 12. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners Club. (212) 860-4455. Advance fee: $30; $20 for club members, $14, 18 and under and 62+. Race-day registration $35, $25 and $15. Children's race fee: $6 in advance, $8 on Sunday.

MONTEFIORE FAMILY HEALTH WALK, the Bronx. Tomorrow at 10 a.m., a walk beginning at the 242nd Street entrance to Van Cortlandt Park; registration begins at 9:30 a.m. Sponsored by Take a Walk, New York! (212) 228-3126. Free.
